channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: How small countries might be impacted by Trump's potential tariffs
item.description: President Trump says a host of small countries should prepare for double-digit tariffs if they fail to reach trade agreements with the U.S. So what do countries like Cambodia export to the U.S.?

item.title: Former FEMA Administrator Deanne Criswell discusses natural disaster response
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks with Deanne Criswell, former administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency under President Biden, about responding to natural disasters.

item.title: President Trump to survey flood damage in central Texas on Friday
item.description: President Trump is expected to visit Kerr County, Texas, on Friday to survey damage from last week's catastrophic flooding and to receive updates from local officials.

item.title: New Hampshire judge blocks Trump birthright citizenship executive order nationwide
item.description: A federal judge in New Hampshire on Thursday blocked President Trump's executive order that attempted to end birthright citizenship, stopping it from taking effect anywhere in the U.S.

item.title: How flood sirens could have saved lives in Texas
item.description: In the wake of the deadly flash floods in Texas, state leaders are exploring whether to install more flood warning sirens. Such sirens can save lives if they're part of a larger warning system.

item.title: Trump got his tax bill over the finish line. Now he has to sell it to voters
item.description: The 900-page tax and policy package fulfills several key campaign promises but also makes cuts that could boot millions from health care and food assistance programs.

item.title: What Trump's One Big Beautiful Bill Act means for taxes on Social Security
item.description: Many Americans received an email from the Social Security Administration applauding the megabill's passage. Experts say it was misleading.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: President Trump heads to Texas Friday to survey flood damage, Trump turns sharply critical of Russia's Putin, DOGE gains access to database that controls government payments to farmers and ranchers.

item.title: PBS documentary 'Made in Ethiopia' looks at Chinese investment in Africa
item.description: The new PBS documentary "Made in Ethiopia" explores China's increasing investment footprint in Africa through three women whose lives are deeply affected by the largest industrial park in Ethiopia.

item.title: Many Israelis are increasingly eager to see war in Gaza end
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu has left the U.S. after meeting President Trump, but with no breakthrough on a Gaza ceasefire. And many Israelis are increasingly eager to see the 21-month war end.
